ETYMOLOGY: Compound of the adverb 'when' (from Old English hwænne) and the adverb 'ever' (from Old English ǣfre).

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: At whatever time; every time that.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: You can start the project whenever you are ready.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 你准备好了就可以随时开始这个项目。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Used in response to indicate that the exact time is not important; any time is acceptable.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 随时都可以；不限时间（用于回答或表示对具体时间不关心）。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: "When should we meet?" "Whenever suits you best."
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: “我们什么时候见面？”“你方便随时都可以。”

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: If and when; assuming that something will happen.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 如果或只要（表示假设或不确定性）。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Whenever the shipment arrives, we will notify you immediately.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 一旦货物到达，我们会立即通知您。
